intro: Polyscias pulgarensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian sycamore, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by round, orange-red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland forests. Polyscias pulgarensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in Hawaiian ecosystems.
